website_summaries.verdict: Low starting price for a printer that will deliver the performance and print quality needed at home.
pros: Offers the ability to print from mobile devices over the WiFi connection, which is easy to set up and use
Paper tray can handle up to 100 blank sheets
Front of printer has a touchscreen display and dozens of buttons to simplify using the device
Includes fax, copy, and scan capabilities
cons: Ink cartridges seem to run out faster than they should

customer_reviews.title: Will not print if ANY ink is empty
customer_reviews.text: The printer has a built in feature that will shut down the printer and make it inoperable if ANY ink is out. You cannot print in Black and White if the Yellow ink is out for example. This feature may be great for Brother because it will force the customer to replace all inks, but it is a horrible feature for the customer. Ruined my morning because I had to go to a print shop to print because even though my black and white ink are 90% full, the printer can't print a word document. The feature renders the printer useless and makes this a one star purchase.
customer_reviews.author: H. Narayanan

customer_reviews.title: Plain, easy, reliable print for cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Between the kids needing school forms printed off and me wanting to work from paper on drafts for my classes we were looking for a printer that wouldn't break the bank. 50 bucks for a Brother color printer seemed to fit the bill and so far it's been solid. Wireless let's me print from my surface anywhere, and w/ the app I can print from my phone too. Pictures don't look perfect but word docs and forms are good, and it can handle color graphs or charts if I'm trying to summarize data visually. If you want something plain to do a job this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: From day 1 constant issues with print quality, particularly with color. Tech support walked me through a fix which used up every bit of ink and then some, but I figured if it fixed the issue it would be worth having to purchase the extra ink, which is super expensive. The fix worked for about 2 months, and now I'm right back where I was to begin with. Poor color quality. Everything is either washed in yellow or red. Tired of the problem. Tired of buying ink. TIRED of this crappy printer. Tossing this heap and buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: What a rip-off!
customer_reviews.text: Stick em’ up. The only purpose of the newer brother printers are to stick you with a high ink bill. I do 99 percent of my printing in black and white. My color cartridges empty at the same rate as the higher yield black cartridge. If the colors are out the printer shuts down even though you install a new black cartridge. After it says the cartridges are empty if you pop the covers off they are 75 percent full. You can refill them. You just have to buy more. Also the printer freezes up halfway through the printing and you have to restart and it is super slow at printing. I’ll never buy another brother.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Not google cloud ready
customer_reviews.text: I searched in the amazon search bar for google cloud ready and this printer popped up.... ITS NOT GOOGLE CLOUD READY UPDATE 3/13/19 This printer already drove screen says receiving data and that’s all. Tried everything still locked up. Drive an hour to the closest service center he said return it no fix... AMAZIN TECH WAS WORTHLESS and COULDNT UNDERSTSAND HIM AT ALL!!!! So hung up and threw printer in garbage
customer_reviews.author: KeithCampbell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and excellent printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We had been looking for a new printer to replace our Epson all in one that was only a couple of years old and had already failed. After owning multiple $150-350 all in one printers and seeing the reviews on this one I decided to give it a try. What was the worst that could happen for the price? So far it has been absolutely excellent. It prints very well, works well printing from our iPhones and is very easy to use. It used very little ink as well surprisingly. Even if it lasts a year I won’t be disappointed. It’s far better than any printer I’ve owned in a long time. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good performance, quality, and more for affordable decent $!! :)
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite All-n-One Printer/Scanner/Fax Machine I've ever owned!.. Really affordable, Tons of good features/options, One of the "Cheaper" Brands-Manufactuerers for replacement ink cartridges in both the "OEM" Factory Brother Inks & Aftermarket Recycled Refillable Generic Brand Inks, Wireless Printing/Scanner/Fax Options as well as numerous others. Prints slower for today's 2018-2019 printers technology but the quality of finished product is pretty freakin nice with minimal ish ink used at least in my short time of owning it so far lol.
customer_reviews.author: RedViper9217

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for. Slow and hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: Meow bought this as Meow needed a printer for some legal documents. It works fine as a basic printer, but is slow. The controls are not intuitive at all. Very poorly designed/engineered in its user friendliness . It is cheap, and you get what you pay for. If you rarely use a printer, and need one just for occasional printing or copying; Then this a economical way to do so. But if you use a printer on a regular basis, Meow would recommend you spend a little more for a printer, and avoid this one.
customer_reviews.author: MeowtheKitty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality of life upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer! Being able to print from any of my devices on my network makes daily tasks simple. This is one of those quality of life upgrades, sure my old HP still works, but having the addition of wireless printing, and double sided printing is fantastic. I bought extra ink, and I’ve used this fella daily for the past two months without a hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Night

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: So far it works good. I'm having a hard time using the duplex option. Doesn't print well on cardstock and duplex on. It can print duplex just fine with regular paper. Scanning and print overall works as expected. The screen walks you through any issues so it's very easy to troubleshoot. The size of the ink cartridges are small. Overall, I think it's great. Highly recommend for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Kyashi

customer_reviews.title: Needs bigger ink storage
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this printer but the fact I have to replace my black ink cartridge, what seems like every other week, doesnt make it love it.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: By far the slowest printer I have ever had!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the slowest printers EVER! With most printers you can go to your print properties and change the print settings to make the printer go faster. Not with this one, you have to go to Brother.com, print a 6 page explanation of how to change the setting on the printer itself. This was an absolute waist of money. I hate that I made this purchase so much buyer's remorse!
customer_reviews.author: MsDee

customer_reviews.title: Printer short circuited the house wirings when switched on for first time
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my brother. He switched it on and printer literally spewed smoke and now obviously shows no sign of life. :'(
customer_reviews.author: Jukasi

customer_reviews.title: Bought on sale, good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I chose this printer based on ink costs- replacements are pretty cheap. Brother is also a reliable brand in general- even if their printers aren't as "pretty" as HP or Cannon. Like most printers, you have to google the drivers to download or it won't work as smoothly as it could. I skipped the bloatware and only downloaded the drivers & updater tool, and it works fine. It's a little slow at printing, but I'm not using it heavily so I don't mind. I set it up in about 15 minutes without issue. Fits nicely next to my PC
customer_reviews.author: Sock

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: The biggest hassle was untangling the wires of the old printer and rethreading the new wires. When I powered this unit up I was prompted to enter the date and time. That's all. Suddenly it started setting itself up and after a few minutes it printed out a test sheet. The next instruction was to start printing. I tried it, and to my complete surprise it printed out the document perfectly !!! Absolutely amazing. I am very pleased with the easy set up of this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Gross

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it loads paper easily and holds a lot of paper. It prints both side automatically, which is a very nice feature. No more printing one side, removing the sheet and flipping it over, then printing side two. Print quality is decent, but having only printed about 100 sheets all in black ink so far, it's to early to assess. All in all, very pleased with the printer. I would definitely recommend it for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BrianK

customer_reviews.title: Crappy photo scan
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement all-in-one. It is a good printer/copier. I have no reason to think it would not fax. However, it is the worst photo copier of my experience. Had I tested this feature sooner I would certainly have returned the printer. Being I am stuck with this printer, I am faced with buying a separate scanner. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: get home alive

customer_reviews.title: This printer works
customer_reviews.text: I have an Mac and previously had another brand that had constant problems. After two years I got rid of it and got this printer. What a difference. It worked right from the start. Very easy to set up with excellent directions. The ink is much cheaper and so not only is the printer inexpensive but the cost of using it less expensive. And it is indeed an all -in- one. The print copies are very good, both color and b&w and so are pictures. So much easier with a good printer.
customer_reviews.author: Steelman

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY THIS PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: This printer is noisy and doesn’t seem to stay in alignment. The resolution of the color photos are great, but due to the alignment issue, I wouldn’t use it for any company or professional use. **UPDATE** This printer is the neediest printer I’ve ever encountered. The paper jams regularly, it blows through ink faster than our HP, it freezes halfway through a print and sometimes it refuses to print anything at all. On more than one occasion it has decided to print random pages only of a multiple page document...so I’ll attempt to print pages 1-20 and only pages 7 and 12 will print. I wouldn’t buy this ever again!
customer_reviews.author: Chad C.

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer I have ever bought for going through ink
customer_reviews.text: I thought that the reason it ran out of ink right away after I bought it, was that it had a sample ink cartridge, so I bought two more, and right away after installing one, it said I was low on ink, so them I put in another, again, low on ink, now I am on my fourth cartridge since I bought the printer in middle of July. I do most of my printing at work, and haven't even gone through a package of paper, and it is telling me I am low on ink again. This is the worst!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Wifi setup is impossible. It continually fails to connect to our wifi network that every other device can use. When it appears to connect, it then quickly drops the connection. Buy something else. Update - I've added a star because the printer seems to be cooperating and working periodically. Still, any time you lose power, you'll have to re-do your connection process. The printer does not remember how to connect to established wifi networks.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap home printer
customer_reviews.text: Have seen and/or worked on just about every make/model printer as I am in the field of IT. This printer is not great but it is okay for households which do not do a lot of printing. Just need to print something now and then. If printing demands are medium to high, I would move on to a level higher than this cheap model. Prefer the Brother interface for setting up and getting scanning working from both the app on the computer and the Scan function on the printer interface screen. Getting HP's interface to work from both the app and the interface screen seems to be problematic.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonProShopper

customer_reviews.title: Prints wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: Great deals on the inks of this! I use often, most of the time for standard paper, but also cardstock. I got it because it is an inkjet, and I have printable fabric to use on it (just haven’t yet). It does not hook up to a computer in a way I am used to, so I would prefer to hook it into the back of my CPU, versus into a front USB I had to fish around it so it wouldn’t be in my way. However, it prints wirelessly too. It isn’t heavy, so you could bring it with you if you needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey E Wrobel

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Works half of the time, constantly running out of ink with maybe 20 pages printed. Will not print black and white when one of the color cartridges is out. Even when changing the settings in the computer to only print black and white, still does not print. You have to spend $200 in cartridges every month to print 10 pages of black and white. Just replaced the yellow ink, printed 1 page in black and white and yellow already shows 25% gone. How? Everything about this printer screams: WE HATE YOU: THE CONSUMER.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a very efficient machine
customer_reviews.text: I use this to print from my computer. So far, so good. I haven't hooked up the fax yet. Don't know if I will. Also will have to use some software or something to get it to scan. Haven't done that, yet. I do need it to scan. I haven't been able to really put this through its paces, because I'm a caregiver, and my patient has had some health issues, but I like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: winnla

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality but Poorly Placed Touch Screen
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer with ease of installation and use with computers and mobile devices. However, the touchscreen is small and located on the front panel instead of the top of the printer. This makes it awkward to change settings if the printer is placed at waist height or lower. I, initially, had difficulty locating the USB port inside the printer. It is in the center towards the front, but the port itself is situated to the right side, so you insert your USB cord from the right side of the printer instead of from front. The most important functions work well, so I will keep this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia S.

customer_reviews.title: My First Brother
customer_reviews.text: Initial setup was no problem. This low cost printer is working very well with better than expected output. The noise level is moderate and speed to print from start up adequate. Each new set of XL ink cartridges will cost the same as the original cost of the printer, no surprise there. Will replace this printer after the one year warranty expires if cost to replace remains the same. This AIO printer is not designed for heavey multioffice use or heavey print jobs, overheating due to heavy use will cut its life expectancy. A good home AIO printer.
customer_reviews.author: H.E.B.

customer_reviews.title: In love with this printer
customer_reviews.text: First day: I absolutely love this printer. I have bought other suppose to be better brands and have always been unhappy with the quality of printing and the difficulty setting up the printer. This was a breeze this morning. The only part that threw me off was to make sure the printer was connected to my internet as well as the device I was using to install. Once both are connected to the internet you can finish the set up process. The print quality is amazing, ink is affordable and I'm just so happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: WillMitch

customer_reviews.title: Like Looking For Waldo
customer_reviews.text: It connects to the computer wirelessly, it connects to the router wirelessly, it connects to my phone wirelessly. When I hit print, yeah, we start looking for the printer... after anywhere from 30 minutes to 3 hours, it prints... oh wait, jammed. Clear the jam, and yes, the printer forgot what it was printing. So find it, hit print... waiting, and I wonder if the printer has been arrested or ran away from home? Okay, about three hours later, whallah! Printed, not great quality, but acceptable. Thank you mister printer for returning home to help me in my endeavor... Oh, don't bother calling tech support, I think my phone is still looking for them too...
customer_reviews.author: Gazmuth

customer_reviews.title: EASY PEASY!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 65-yr-old woman, who isn’t very tech savvy. I had a Brother printer that stopped working after many years, so I chose Brother again. I received this printer today, and had it set up in 15 minutes, including wireless printing from my phone. Piece of cake! And the print quality is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: RKB

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Don't get to use it a whole lot. Brought It mainly for price hopefully it will last although inkjet printers seem to have an issue if you don't use them very often with the Jets getting clogged up which is what happened to my previous printer. Had no issues setting up seems to print fast enough for what I'm doing printing out emails receipts from online ordering those kinds of things. I don't ever really print pictures consumes too much ice and the quality is never that great with an inkjet printer. my wife has had one now for several years and has had no issues with her and replacement ink is relatively inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: cliff

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Well, started out with a "lesser model" as we all know that the printers themselves are "cheap" and they're all about the same..right. No. So the cheaper model, $50, used same ink cartridges as this one, was OK, but Slow and no touch screen so it was even slower if you had to do something in the settings. Got rid of that one for this one, a little more upscale but it's perfect. Fast, the automatic document feeder is great, works beautifully. Can't go wrong on this one and it didn't take you to the poorhouse.
customer_reviews.author: patricia l. peterson

customer_reviews.title: This printer or an ink cartridge for an HP printer - hmm, tough choice
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought an HP printer at Costco and I was happy until I realized I had to buy HP ink for it (not the cheaper alternatives). I was so annoyed that for the same price as I would have paid for an ink cartridge I was able to buy this all-in-one printer. It doesn't come with much ink (they keep reminding you that it's "starter" ink), but I don't mind. I bought 10 ink cartridges for $35 here on Amazon and now I'm good to go for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sabby

customer_reviews.title: It’s a $50 printer
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used it much, seems photo printing a little slow but expected for $50. Maine issue is that it does not come with the USB cable also does not come with any paper. I’m use to at least 10 15 sheets to test maybe couple gloss photo paper also, but nothing. Plus the warranty you can only sign up if you live in Canada Seems to print ok so far.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S

customer_reviews.title: Printer is fine. Replacing the ink is a scam.
customer_reviews.text: It nice and cheap and works well until the ink runs out. It doesn't really run out but that chip makes the printer think that( shaking it and hearing ink sloshing inside means theres more in there) and wont work until you replace. I don't fall for that ink scam so I simply throw it out and purchase another cheap printer with ink. I've thrown many perfect printers out do to the corporate greed to rob ones money to fool you into buying 35cents worth of ink for anywhere from $17.99-$40.00 or more just for black ink. It's odd how when one only use black ink to print out pdf files the yellow & canyon ink seems to deplete first.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas R

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible product. The printer constantly jams up on simple 20# paper and simple print jobs. It's cheaply manufactured. I'm shocked at how poorly this Brother product performs. The only reason I purchased this product was because my old Brother all in one printer was outstanding. Now I'm stuck with this ridiculous crap because my return window has closed. And by the way I've only used this printer on nine separate occasions and with each print job it jammed. I'm completely dissatisfied with this product and I don't recommend anyone purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: Laro

customer_reviews.title: Working as expected
customer_reviews.text: Having it for two weeks now. Still having the temporary ink installed. I did not noticed taking too much ink as others complains or using extensive ink in cleaning. Also all late printers used some ink to keep the head clean and flowing, and that is necessary to all new and high definition printers. Besides, the aftermarket ink is really affordable and available on Amazon. In fact I already ordered a set as backup. It is fast and easy to install. I love the fact that accepts two ways of scanning and it connect to my wifi with no problem. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Meduza

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Purchase
customer_reviews.text: We bough this shortly after the holidays and I'm thrilled we did so. The quality has been fantastic! We print a fair bit (online sales and labels, kids coloring pages, Hobby related fun) and it took a solid 3-4 months before we needed to replace the black ink cartridge. We've printed sparingly in color but at this point it's looking like this was the best pre-pandemic purchase we could have made. The range on the wireless seems to be solid as well. We've got this situated in the basement and sending a print job via phone from the main floor has never failed. I would gladly recommend this printer to anyone in the market.
customer_reviews.author: J.M. Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: NICE printer and it just works all the time..
customer_reviews.text: finally got rid of my Canon POS,, Brother is nice printer,, I LIKE the brother printer , easy setup , completely prints pages in 3-5 seconds after pushing print button. takes some getting used to menus and buttons , but it actually works and feeds unlike my cannon, I lie the individual Color cartridges as well, lets se how far the ink goes.
customer_reviews.author: T. Schantz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a few months and it has performed flawlessly. This relpaced an HP printer that was having trouble connecting to my wifi. The straw that boke the back was when I installed a new XL color cartridge and the printer kept telling me that the cartridge was bad ( it was an original HP inkjet printer cartridge). I was not going to pay anymore exorbitant prices for HP inkjet cartridges. Bought this Brother printer and I am completely satisfied. (Side note: I do not print very much, maybe 15-20 pages/month).
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Junk Printer...Ghost Paper Jam
customer_reviews.text: 13 months and it decides to tell us it has a ghost paper jam. My wife hated this from the beginning: won’t handle thicker paper, jams all the time, prints/wastes a piece of paper telling you how much ink you have at random times. Now, it stopped working. Says to clear a non-existent jam! There is no jam! Factory reset is a farce. Does nothing. Powered off, pulled plug out, paper tray, squeezed the two green levers, etc....and nothing! I see reviews like this about every major brand. Brother was just the best of the worst...and they’re all the worst! Kids are going back to school soon...we need a printer that isn’t a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Scanner is great, look elsewhere for a printer
customer_reviews.text: With the niche exception of printing photos, inkjet printers are kind of a scam. This printer is no different. The ink cartridges register as nearly empty after pathetically few pages. I bought it for the scanner, which is great. I needed an Automatic Document Feeder/ADF scanner, and those can get painfully expensive on their own. The flatbed scanner is also capable of scanning photos at up to 1200x1200 DPI. The only drawback is that Windows doesn't recognize the capabilities of this scanner, so you need to install the proprietary Brother iPrint&Scan software. Fortunately, it isn't terrible, and it even makes OCR quite easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Up and runnning!
customer_reviews.text: Received this printer in the mail yesterday. Took me about 30 minutes to set up following the quick start guide that came with the printer. I have it connected to my Wi-Fi network and am able to print wirelessly from all the computers in my house. I primarily only use this for word documents, shipping labels, and other miscellaneous documents so this does the trick. The alternative is to print at a print & ship center where you have to pay some ludicrous fee per copy so this is a much better solution.
customer_reviews.author: Bill BTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Took longer to receive than they said. Stressed out by the everyday notifications that it was coming that day and didn't come. I needed it soon because I have my own business and work from home. I went through the process of uninstalling the old and trying to install this one only to find that something was wrong with the start up ink cartridge chips. Without using them can not complete installation!!!!! Waiting for replacements and I have to send the useless ones back for inspection. I am delayed and upset. I will never buy electronics from here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jams ALL the time
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: It jams ALL the time. If you try to print something more than a few pages long you can guarantee that it will not work. It prints sideways on the page all the time as well. I would not recommend this printer AT ALL. I have tried different brands of paper and cleaned the paper roller more times than I can count. Nothing works. I was able to set this up on my own easily. The print quality is good. Printing via the cloud or mobile device is simple. I'm glad I bought this because it meets all my needs. The paper does get jammed easily when the tray is low so keep it full.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Price

customer_reviews.title: Simply will NOT print!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Brother MFC-J491DW "printer" in March 2020. I do very little printing, but need one from time to time, so bought on a recommendation from a friend. It has been the most frustrating thing I've bought in a while. Will NOT print from my brand new Windows 10 computer. Goes to the print que and just sits there. Prints from my iPhone, though, so what gives? Worthless online tech support. Unreachable by phone. Really, I have nothing good to say about it. If I could contact support, I would ask to return, since it has a year warranty. Stay AWAY from this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Beginner printer.
customer_reviews.text: 10/16/2019 Had Brother Printers before and always had good results. Was going back to Brother from my HP which I have used for the last four years without even a paper jam. Wanted to get cheaper ink with the Brother. Had hard time installing the soft work and when I got it to print it took over 30 seconds to print 1 page with above noise level. Been use to HP 4630 and no comparison. Decided to return for refund. Got notice refund would be complete with-in 5 business days. My account shows refund made on 10/10/2019. I still have not got it. POOR BUSINESS. wjc
customer_reviews.author: wjc

customer_reviews.title: Just right for home printing
customer_reviews.text: Likes: (Amazon) delivered this the same day I ordered it in the morning ! So near-immediate use of printing at home ! Clean, clear copies; ease to sneak in colored paper and labels (upside down). Quiet "clicking" sound, so I know it is working, but not annoying loud sound. Compact size, so doesn't take up much space. Just plug in - easy install. What more could an occasional print person like me want? Have not used tech support as too new. Directions in booklet clear but could use a bit more detail for home novices like me. It works !! Great !!
customer_reviews.author: Moretime

customer_reviews.title: Very compatible with Apple products!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, I was worried about this order after I read some reviews but I’m very happy with this printer! Fast easy set up, already tried it out with an IPad/ IPhone/ Mac. No need to download any app for any of those products! Prints pictures in about 2 minutes but prints text very fast. Finally got to scan in my mortgage payment receipts and this wireless printer sends it direct to my email. Have not tried a fax yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jason e.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Have had the printer for a while now and no problems or issues. Easy to set up, went to website. Use app.off my phone quite a bit, very convenient. Was worried that because is was inexpensive, it may not work that well. No issues with slow printing as other reviews mentioned, easy to scan and print from phone app.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: It does enough not to fail
customer_reviews.text: I bought this items, as I need printing, scanning, and copying capabilities. This printer can do all of these things, but it kills me how slow this printer is. The details page says 12 ppm max for the output speed, but it rarely hits this. The printer feels cheap, has a lot of movement, and is really loud. The screen on the printer has a distortion line through it, that randomly appeared after a week. If you are strapped for cash and just printing homework, then sure get this. Otherwise spend the money and invest in something better. I'll be replacing mine soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jester21777

customer_reviews.title: Eats ink too fast.
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a good printer when we got it. But.. we soon found out that it doesn't print 2 sided without jamming up.. every single time! Then, we found that it either uses way too much ink or the tanks are so small that we need to replace in twice as often (at a higher price per set) than any of our Canon printers. Not impressed with this machine at all. We weren't looking for perfection but this thing doesn't even match up to its own specs.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Conley

customer_reviews.title: Too many false jams reported
customer_reviews.text: This printer would be a great printer if it were not for the false jams reported much too regularly. About 50 – 60 percent of the time it shows a paper jam even when only 1 page prints and it exits perfectly, yet shows a paper jam. Crazy right? Other than that it prints fast with excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: MaccDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer at a very fair price
customer_reviews.text: This Brother Printer/Scan/Fax was purchased to replace a Canon PIXMA Series Printer. I was skeptical at first, as the price is very reasonable. The Printer works better than expected. Fast print speed, easy to set-up, and the best part... The Factory Ink Cartridges are very well priced in comparison to other brands, about half the price. This as an All-in-One Printer, and it also takes less space on your desk or stand than other models. So far I am very pleased with this Printer so far. Will keep you posted!
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Good but Jams Frequently
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer because it is affordable and duplexes. Excellent there! However...especially when duplexing, the printer often jams. It's a serious issue. Like, every other page kind of jam. So that's a disappointment for sure. Still, I appreciate the low price point, and the wireless works well.
customer_reviews.author: Cyansunlight

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: My old Brother finally gave up and I was forced to purchase a new one. I was hoping to find a printer that would use the same ink as my other one, but was unable to make that match :( So I purchased this little machine and I am very happy with that decision! It was very similar to my old one, only a little smaller and lighter. It was very easy to set up and that is coming from someone who is computer illiterate! The print color is good, it prints fast and it is nice and quiet. I highly recommend this machine to anyone who needs a printer for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Castle Queen

customer_reviews.title: Extremely loud and violent sounding, but good value at this price point
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the loudest and most violent sounding printer we have ever owned. It is about as cheaply built, as a printer can possibly be. That said, it does a decent job (excellent for the price point) overall. Setup was easy. Beware that this printer is ONLY WIRELESS. There is not an Ethernet port on it. So, wired LAN use is not possible.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!!
customer_reviews.text: I was completely impressed with how much this printer can do. Easy to set up. The little screen tells you step by step what to do for everything. The BEST thing about this computer is you can link it to Google Docs and directly upload to your account. I imagine you can do it with plenty of other platforms too. There's so much I haven't explored yet, but this is the best printer I've ever had!!
customer_reviews.author: Michele Easterly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup. Good low cost all-in-one.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a low cost printer that could print good quality documents at moderate speed, and with a good scanner. This printer meets those expectations. Wireless setup is easy and intuitive. The 4 ink cartridges are easy to install. Color quality for documents is acceptable, but I haven't tried photos yet - something I rarely do. Setting the print quality from "normal" to "fast" speeds things up quite a bit but sacrificing quality. This is not a fast printer and I wouldn't recommend for heavy duty office work. The scanner is about as fast as any I've ever used and quality is pretty good. I don't use these machines for faxing.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: It is by far the easiest printer that I've had to pleasure to set up. Not very gimmicky or pushy about making you a member of their club which is a definite plus. Consistently reliable and doesn't shut off if the ink is low... it will keep printing to the bitter end (thank goodness). I would definitely buy this printer again... as long as it holds up for another year mind you. :)
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Keesling

customer_reviews.title: Really good col our printer for classroom
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for your buck. I am a teacher prepping for the new school year and needed color printing for special education students. Did so much printing I used up the yellow ink but it's reasonably priced to replace and all my classroom signs etc for the year are done. Pretty impressed. The signing into wifi was a downside tho. Really tedious keypad thingy.
customer_reviews.author: Nechama

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup - Working great so far...
customer_reviews.text: This printer had the easiest setup I've every experienced with and all in one printer. (this is my third) It took no more than 15 minutes - may be longer if you're setting up Fax. I won't be using that function. So far, in the little time I've had it - printing has been very easy using my home WIFI system. I'm going to try to update my review once I have to re-order ink - usually that's a headache that comes with sticker shock. Consider this review to be continued...
customer_reviews.author: Drea_Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Friggin Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: When this thing friggin works, the print quality is great. But it NEVER WORKS. I liked all of the different features for the price, but it is the least user-friendly printer I've ever used. It's constantly cleaning itself for no reason, and there's an update inexplicably every few weeks. Ever time I try to print something, it's an hour-long troubleshooting endeavor. Over it. Next time I won't cheap out.
customer_reviews.author: Pilar Broggi

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I like that the ink tanks don't house a print head which makes them less expensive to replace when needed. Touchscreen is a bit small. When fully powering down the machine you have to confirm that you want to shut off fax function before it powers off. This is a bit annoying since you have to stand there and wait for it to power off. Also, no true manual feed tray. All media goes into the main paper tray.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Very problematic printer
customer_reviews.text: Have had this printer for nearly 6 months now. Facing a lot of problems * Connecting over the network is quite unreliable. No easy troubleshooting steps online or along with the package. * Printer quality is decent. But cuts out the edges quite badly * Initial cartridge ran out very quickly * Very hard to find original printer cartridges. And the printer cartridges are very expensive for a printer of this price. * Constant problems with the UI interface. Error messages are unclear, confusing. Constantly complains of paper jams when there are no paper jams. Unfortunately, there aren't too many good alternatives either. Honestly printing is a pain with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: pookie

customer_reviews.title: Hellish wifi setup, installs crapware, but pretty decent printer
customer_reviews.text: Despite a wireless setup process that I can only describe as hellish, this printer does an adequate job of rendering electronic documents onto physical paper. Really, it's not too bad for the price. I highly recommend not purchasing their overpriced ink refills though! One note. Scanning photos is hilarious. In no scenario could any sort of photo scan ever be usable. Document scanning is fine. Beware of the crapware the installer tries to give you as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer. The price and design is the best I have ever owned. Wireless setup was seamless. Perfect for my home based office needs. (Update) After owning the printer for a few months I am more pleased with it now than when I first plugged it in. For the money you cannt find a better product. Wireless features are incredible. Very fast. Perfect print quality. Love being able to replace cartridges easily from the front panel. Best printer I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Good print quality for the price, but the money you save on this printer will be spent on replacement ink cartridges. Yes, I know that is the game we are supposed to play with home printers but Brother takes it a step further with this one. This printer doesn’t let you print in b&w/grayscale without color toner, yellow is often the culprit (I did some searching and there appears to be a workaround for this, but I just want my printer to print the 3 times a year that I use it...without the hoops.)
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Complete scam and a rip-off. Never again
customer_reviews.text: I never print in color, yet magically I'm out of yellow toner. The machine then basically bricks itself until you buy new cartridge. Your can't even print black or grayscale even though the black toner is completely full. It won't even let me scan to my PC! F this company and their products. I thought HP was bad with their dirty tactics but at least I could print black and white if my color toner was out on my last HP printer!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Gordon Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Nice all-in-one inkjet printer
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical after reading mixed reviews and low price on this printer but I this is a great compact machine. It was fairly easy to set up. Just follow the instructions. The machine is much quieter than the HP8620Pro that it replaces and the output is superior to the other machine, as well. I really can't think of anything negative to say about this MFC-J491DW All-In-One duplex color inkjet printer. I'm delighted with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill L

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price.  Just a bit slower to print, but prints great.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. But it will not connect to my smart phone all the time from the iPrint&Scan Brothers, app. Once in awhile it will. Plus, it prints a bit slower. But my husband likes it. So I bought a more expensive printer in the same series. Addendum: I finally figured out how to get it to print straight from my cell phone. One must have WiFi direct on/connected & then the cell phone can print to printer. So it's a nice printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Feline Lover

customer_reviews.title: Budget all-in-one with nice features.
customer_reviews.text: It is a very user friendly all-in-one with a nice feature set. I have it working nicely with my Ubuntu Linux laptop and my wife's Windows 10 PC. It's more of a home use machine. It doesn't feel as rugged as most office quality machines. But for the price it is a solid machine for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We had 4 printers in the house, all wired, and needed ONE that was wireless that worked with both Mac and PC and all the devices we have around the house. Probably the only downside is that it's inkjet when the others we had were laser (but wired) but the ease of installation and use (I just push a button from my phone, iPad, macbook, and PC) if I want to print something and it's done pretty much canceled out any of my complaints. Laser is always good but this one does the job we need.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer ever
customer_reviews.text: Words cannot describe how truly terrible this printer is. Out of 100 Pages I'd say 95 of them Jam. I'm constantly having to pull the paper tray out and remove Jam paper., Reload the tray. Nothing is simple with this POS. I'd say occasionally when I remote print from my smartphone it works but most of the time I still have to walk over and unjam the paper.
customer_reviews.author: Marna Howard

customer_reviews.title: I really like the printer, except...
customer_reviews.text: The printer was pretty easy to setup. It was my first time for a wireless printer. After following the directions and printing a few pages, I was happy to see it worked just fine. I then set it up to print from my phone. Downloaded the app and got it all setup fairly easily. Although it does print from my phone, it appears that it will only print from my gmail email account, not my other and way more used accounts. I cannot see a way to include them for printing. It's a big hassle to have to forward to gmail in order to print. Otherwise, it does work just as advertised. Wireless is quite awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Upchurch

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I have had in years.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and ease of set up with this printer. I have gotten rid of my dinosaur PC and not only use my tablet and phone. It was very quick to set up scanning, printing, pdf conversion and everything I need to not miss my pc one bit. I also like that I simply send a file and it prints. This is unlike many fussy printers I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Greatest printer I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: Greatest printer I’ve ever used and I’ve sold 428 printers on EBay . Super fast and easy to setup , works on ever device I have without downloading anything but the install software on my main pc that it’s connected to . Every other wireless device (tablets , iPhones, laptops ..) I just hit print , select the printer and it wirelessly prints immediately ! Worth every penny ! And it prints both sides of the paper if you want
customer_reviews.author: Kluntor Boogie

customer_reviews.title: Printing OK but scanning terrible
customer_reviews.text: The printing is slow but seems to work ok. But scanning images is terrible. I've tried different software (including the Brother software). I've tried cleaning the screen (although it's brand new). I've tried everything I could think of, but the image quality is just terrible. I'm going to have to purchase a separate scanner for pictures. I get better images by taking a picture of the picture with my phone. If you want something to scan images with, don't buy this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian McCombs

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless printing, no lag or delay starts printing instantly, printing is kind of slow but not a big deal. Print quality is decent not very strong colors. The fax feature is a great bonus but is tricky to use, I wish you were able to also send a fax using the scanner especially for smaller documents or IDs.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer!
customer_reviews.text: It seems like someone actually put some thought into this printer. Easy to set up (installed on the wireless network perfectly the FIRST try!), the automatic duplexer works nicely, and it has separate ink cartridges so you don't waste ink. The scanner works flawlessly, too. Don't know about the fax (didn't that technology die many years ago???) Printed photos look good, too. I highly recommend this printer over others at the same price point.
customer_reviews.author: Joe W.

customer_reviews.title: not the Worst printer ever.
customer_reviews.text: Got this printer 4.5 months ago and it has never been great. I use it to print less than 10 pages a week and it jams every time. You have to load paper each time you use it and then more than three pages means another jam. After an hour on the phone with Brothers they were able to fix the issue and it is working great.
customer_reviews.author: GM&F

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This printer is terrible, it eat inks at the fastest rate I have ever seen. There is no way I am getting 200 sheets out of the XL ink cartridges. The low price is there because Brother knows they will kill you with ink costs. It rarely if ever keeps a wifi connection so you go to print and you spend 30 mins reconnecting the printer even though nothing has changed in your network. Stay away go get an Epson like I did for twice the price but its twice as nice.
customer_reviews.author: D Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Will eat every single page that you try to print double-sided, don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Printer cannot duplex, which is the only reason I purchased it. Save your money and buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Blubaugh

customer_reviews.title: Good for school
customer_reviews.text: There is no touch screen-I don’t know why that is rated on the review. I did not use tech support. Set up was very easy. Print quality is good for my needs. I don’t use the fax. Machine is very noisy. It has a quit mode but prints very slowly.Loading the paper from the bottom is awkward. Easy to change cartridges. Paper tray is poor quality and I have concerns about its durability. Best as back up for school.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Brown

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: We have had this printer since March. It intermittently decides it just doesn't want to print. A recent Windows update caused it to stop working, the wind blows and it doesn't work (sarcasm.) It's ridiculous. A very frustrating purchase. Sadly, I don't have the energy to putting into this review all of the details of how maddening this printer has been for us, but suffice it to say that another option is a good way to go. Especially considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: K Walker

customer_reviews.title: A breeze to setup & works Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up wirelessly! Under 10 mins including software installation.. Brother is a great overall value; ink replacement is very cheap and can use any remanufactured cartridges around 5$ I have tested the double sided wireless printing / scanner and fax .. Works Flawlessly Print quality is good & as expected for an inkjet printer at this price point
customer_reviews.author: J.Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Everything You Would Want in a Home Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer has everything you would really need for a home printer and more. Very easy step-up and connected seamlessly with my windows and chromo book. It is well made and sturdy and yet not extremely large. The screen and buttons are great and thr display is easy to follow. All of this for a fantastic price, honestly it feels like a steal. Much better than HP printers.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Luke

customer_reviews.title: Poor setting instructions
customer_reviews.text: I returned it immediately. Setting is too manual and instructions are poor.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, dependable
customer_reviews.text: I've always been an Epson person but no more. We have had this printer a few months and I'm really happy with how it prints consistently every time. Easy to set up, easy on the ink. My only issue is that I wish I'd checked to see if it had a manual feed. It doesn't so you have to load any paper you use into the drawer. But this is an inexpensive printer and I think it is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Designing Woman

customer_reviews.title: A lot for the money
customer_reviews.text: I just can’t believe how inexpensive it is. It does everything I needed, including a document feeder and duplex printing. (Note—the auto feeder cannot be used for duplex-to-duplex copying with this printer, but you can use the ADF to go from one-sided to duplex.)
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Awkward Installation
customer_reviews.text: This Brother Printer has an unbelievably antiquated set up for Mac/ IOS and connecting to Wifi.... Customer support is good... only if you can maintain connection. Customer support connection failed 3x in the process to resolve the wifi connection issues. I can say that I did achieve connection but it took over an hour of trying to do something that should, in 2020 technology, have been seamless.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the home office !
customer_reviews.text: The quality isn't top notch when it comes to color printing, however it gets the job done. If you want a printer with higher resolution for color, then this isn't it. However, if you are a gradstudent who studies at home and want a printer with all the works for cheap, then this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Djuobah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: We like everything about the printer except the buttons you need to press to make a copy or scan are very small. I'm thinking we have to place the printer on a taller cabinet so the buttons are eye level rather than having to bend down and try to see which button to press. Otherwise it is great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine Arundell

customer_reviews.title: great home office printer/scanner
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect over wifi, good quality prints, including pictures. Seems to go easy on the ink and accepts non-brand cartridges. small size means it doesn't take up too much space on my desk
customer_reviews.author: the penguin & owl

customer_reviews.title: Error message that seems to be an error.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps telling me there is a paper jam when there is none. I have shook it, blown it, examined it...no paper but it will not reset. I have unplugged multiple times to try and reset. Followed a video on how to reset, nothing. I know it is an inexpensive printer but expected it to last longer than 5 months. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Princess Di

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Uncomplicated but Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer because I was continuing to have problems with my HP randomly disconnecting and taking half a day to get back online. The Brother printer was an inexpensive alternative and to be honest, I didn't expect much because of the low price. Wow! Did I get fooled. Right out of the box it was so simple to set up. Fifteen minutes and it was ready to go. I have yet to have to reset it like my previous printer, and it does a great print job.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Printer
customer_reviews.text: Connects like crap. Can't get it to print half of the time. It's a battle with anything you want to do with it. Says it is offline on my computer and won't connect. But the printer is on and says it is connected to wifi. Literally buy any other printer. This one is not user friendly. You need an experienced person to figure this stupid thing out. Not a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Humboldt

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: My previ0us Brother printed had more scanning options. The print quality is very good, the copy quality is very good. The scanning quality is very good. It is a little slow, but then it is very reasonably priced. You have to give up something to save money. If this is going to be used in a busy office I would get the faster model. For occasional home use it does very well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grafford

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth Buying!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a printer that printed one page every 3hrs. I own a small business and I don't have time to wait to print anything. I got rid of it, didn't even return it and purchased a Canon printer for small business and it was the best purchase ever, in a printer.
customer_reviews.author: Botanique Baron Samedi

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on good reviews and a previous good experience with a similar printer. I am currently trying to print a 5-page document, and I've had to cancel it and send again due to errors 3 times now. With my old printer (that worked well for three years) that kind of thing happened seldom. Error messages and inability to print simple docs is a routine occurrence now. The cartridges are more expensive, too. I wouldn't have bought this one if I'd known it would be so glitchy. Now it's here, unboxed and set up, and I have regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Brad  Gamett

product_meta.title: Brother Wireless All-in-One Inkjet Printer, MFC-J491DW, Multi-Function Color Printer, Duplex Printing, Mobile Printing,Amazon Dash Replenishment Enabled, Black, 8.5 (MFCJ491DW)
product_meta.description:
The Brother Work Smart Series MFCJ491DW all in one color inkjet printer is easy to connect, compact, economical and loaded with features and functionality that make it essentially the perfect printer for your home, home office or dorm room. This wireless color inkjet all in one printer delivers high quality, reliable printing, copying, scanning and faxing in a desk friendly footprint to fit just about anywhere. The MFC J491DW offers automatic duplex (two sided) printing that helps save paper.

The MFC J491DW delivers wireless mobile printing that lets you print from your desktop, laptop, smartphone or tablet(1). Use the automatic document feeder and 100 sheet capacity paper tray for generous output without constant monitoring or refilling. Cloud connectivity lets you scan to popular cloud services directly from the printer including Google Drive, Dropbox, Box, OneDrive, Evernote and more(2). You can also easily capture and convert documents using Brother Cloud Apps(3). Ink replacement is a snap with separate ink cartridges that easily pop in and out. High yield replacement cartridges help you save with every printed page. The 1.8” color display lets you easily navigate onscreen menus to simplify workflows. Includes a one year limited warranty and free online, call or live chat support for the life of the printer.

(1)Requires connection to a wireless network. (2)Requires an Internet connection and an account with desired service. (3)Requires internet connection. (4)Reprinted from pcmag.com with permission. Copyright 2017 Ziff Davis, LLC. All Rights Reserved. (5)Based on ISO/IEC 24734 (after first set of ISO test pages). For more details, visit manufacturer’s website. (6)The mobile device must have NFC capability and run Android OS 4.4 or later.

Power Source AC 120V 50/60Hz. Operating Temperature- 50-95°.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
800-405-0652
feature_bullets: Simple to connect: Choose from built in wireless or connect locally to a single PC or Mac via USB interface. MFCJ491DW offers easy to set up wireless networking
Mobile printing: Print wirelessly from mobile devices(1) using Air Print, Google Cloud Print, Brother iPrint & Scan, Mopria and Wi Fi Direct
Cloud connectivity: Scan to popular Cloud services directly from the printer including Google Drive, Dropbox, Box, One Drive and more(2)
Versatile paper handling: Automatic document feeder and up to 100 sheet capacity paper tray for letter/legal size paper for flexible printing
For use with brother genuine inks: LC3011BK, LC3011C, LC3011M, LC3011Y, LC3013BK, LC3013C, LC3013M, LC3013Y
Amazon dash replenishment enabled: Upon activation, Amazon Dash Replenishment measures the ink level and orders more from Amazon when it’s low

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,706 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
